intro: Microlicia quinquenervis, commonly known as the five-veined microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, palmate leaves with five distinct veins, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
